text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to refer to section 44(5) of the Arbitration Act 1996 when considering the court's power when the tribunal cannot act. The candidate answer mentions section 44 (specifically s.44(2)) in the table under section 1 and in section 4, but it never explicitly mentions or discusses section 44(5). Section 44(5) deals with the court's power to grant interim relief where the tribunal has no power or is unable to act, which is highly relevant to the scenario where the court steps in because the tribunal cannot act quickly enough.
